“We are excited to partner with Tarleton State University in this endeavor,” said Brock Superintendent Cade Smith. “Because of the leadership of Dr. Hurley, his team and Tarleton State, the students of Brock ISD will have a tremendous opportunity to further their education. We could not be more ecstatic.”

The Guaranteed Award Program (GAP) assures first-time-in-college students graduating in the top quarter of their high school class between $1,000 and $4,000 in scholarships. Students graduating from one of Tarleton’s Distinguished High School Partners will receive an additional $500 or $1,000. Admitted freshmen must submit a general scholarship application to determine eligibility.

Parker County school districts are grateful for the patience and support of their communities as we all work together to serve our students and their families during this time.

Celebrating its 24th year, the Harvey Academy honors exemplary teachers in the memory of Professor Emeritus Jack Harvey, who taught at WC for 23 years and was considered among his peers as a “master teacher.”

Her nomination states, “She has established a classroom full of student voice and support, she is always seeking ways to ensure the students are excited about learning, we are blessed to have her in Brock ISD."

All after-school and extracurricular activities have also been canceled for Wednesday.

We will monitor road conditions throughout the day on Wednesday and if we feel roads are still unsafe on Wednesday afternoon we will communicate information related to the Thursday school day with you. At this point, school will resume Thursday, February 6th at the normal time.

Thank you for your continued support of Brock ISD.

Stay warm and safe,
Cade

post_text:
Information regarding the proposed traffic light at 1189 and Eagle Spirit Lane:
Last spring, TxDOT informed us that the design of the light was taking place and noted that construction would begin in April, light testing in May, and completion in June. TxDOT has informed us that the poles for the lights are on backorder, and are expected to arrive in September. As you can imagine, this is disappointing and frustrating news to all of us. Unfortunately, at this point, it does not appear they will have the light ready by the beginning of the 2019-20 school year. We are hopeful that it will be installed and working soon after we come back to school.
